com.sterlingcommerce.ui.web.platform.struts

Class SCUIAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.opensymphony.xwork2.ActionSupport
      • com.sterlingcommerce.ui.web.platform.struts.SCUIAction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.opensymphony.xwork2.Action, com.opensymphony.xwork2.interceptor.ParameterNameAware, com.opensymphony.xwork2.LocaleProvider, com.opensymphony.xwork2.TextProvider, com.opensymphony.xwork2.Validateable, com.opensymphony.xwork2.ValidationAware, java.io.Serializable, org.apache.struts2.interceptor.ServletResponseAware
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SCUIControllerAction, SCUICSHelpAction, SCUIRedirectToJspAction, SCUIRequestLogAction, SCUIWizardControllerAction, SCUIXAPIAggregatorMashupAction, SCUIXAPIMashupAction

    public abstract class SCUIAction
extends com.opensymphony.xwork2.ActionSupport
implements org.apache.struts2.interceptor.ServletResponseAware, com.opensymphony.xwork2.interceptor.ParameterNameAware
    Any action class needs to extend this method. And it should override its onExecute method. By default, the onExecute method does nothing and returns 'SUCCESS'. Execute method of this class, first authenticates the action based on the resourceId parameter provided for the action definition. It then executes the onExecute method.
    This action expects few parameters which should be defined along with action definition.
    Parameters:
    • resourceId: (optional) If provided, authorization check will be done on provided resource id.

    This action returns following results:

    • SUCCESS - For success
    • AUTHORIZATIONERROR - If authorization error occurs
    • VALIDATIONERROR - If validation error occurs
    • ERROR- If general error occurs

    asmishra
    See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public final java.lang.String execute()
                               throws java.lang.Exception
        This method first does the authorization check for action resource using #authorize(SCUIContext) method. Once the authorization is done, #onExecute(SCUIContext) method is called on the object. Any returned value by onExecute method is returned as result by this action. This method catches SCUIAuthorizationException, SCUIValidationException and SCUIException, which can be thrown either by #authorize(SCUIContext) or #onExecute(SCUIContext) methods. action result com.opensymphony.xwork2.ActionSupport#execute()
        Specified by:
        execute in interface com.opensymphony.xwork2.Action
        Overrides:
        execute in class com.opensymphony.xwork2.ActionSupport
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • onExecute

        protected abstract java.lang.String onExecute(SCUIContext uiContext)
        This method should be overridden by class extending this class. All business logic can be written in this method. This method needs to return a string which will be used as action result. uiContext action result.

      • authorize

        protected void authorize(SCUIContext uiContext)
        This method authorizes user against resourceId provided in action definition. If not resourceId is provided, authorization check is skipped.
        If authorization fails, a SCUIAuthorizationException is thrown; if successful a Boolean attribute SCUIConstants#STRUTS_ACTION_AUTHORIZED is set on the uiContext. uiContext

      • acceptableParameterName

        public boolean acceptableParameterName(java.lang.String parameterName)
        Utility method which returns true if the action will accept the parameter with the given name.
        This implementation automatically rejects/ignores resourceId and requestMethodSupported parameters posted from the client, for security purposes. parameterName parameter name true if parameter is acceptable
        Specified by:
        acceptableParameterName in interface com.opensymphony.xwork2.interceptor.ParameterNameAware
